document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan Ž. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.masterDocTitle: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Caucasus as a major hotspot of biodiversity: Evidence from the millipede family Anthroleucosomatidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida)

heading.emphasis:
Vegrandosoma tabacarui
gen. et sp. nov.

Posterior gonopods, anterior view. H. Posterior gonopods, lateral view. c = coxite; o = opening; t = telopodite; ap = anterior coxsl process; ca = cavity; cp = coxal process; cv = coxsal vesicle; lg = longitudinal groove; mt = medial subtringular part; pp = posterior coxal process; sp = sternal plate; ss = sternal sac; asp = anterior sternal process; sap = small anterior process.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Same as for the genus.

Etymology. The new species is named after Dr. Ionel Tabacaru, a prominent diplopodologist with significant contributions to the taxonomy of Anthroleucosomatidae , and certainly one of the greatest artists among myriapodologists.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 164.
Vegrandosoma tabacarui
gen. et sp. nov. , holotype male anterior gonopods. A. Anterior view. B. Posterior view. ca = cavity; cp = coxal process; mt = medial subtriangular structure; sp = sternal plate; ss = sternal sac; asp = anterior sternal process; sap = small anterior process. Scale line = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
RUSSIA : Stavropol Province, Mamaysky forest , near Stavropol
.
Description. Body with 28 segments (including telson) in adults.
MEASUREMENTS. Males 4.5–5 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.4 mm . Females 5–6 mm long, vertical diameter of the largest pleurotergite 0.45–0.5 mm .

HEAD . Without frontal depression in males. Labrum with three medial teeth and 4+4 labral and 2+2 supralabral setae. Promentum triangular, without setae. Lingual plates with 4+4 setae, on each plate arranged in one row. Stipites with ca 15+15 setae. Antennae 0.7 mm long in paratype male from Tamansky forest, Stavropol , Russia . Length of antennomeres (in mm): I (0.05), II (0.09), III (0.15), IV (0.09), V (0.16), VI (0.08), VII (0.07) and VIII (0.01). Length/breadth ratios of antennomeres I–VII: I (1), II (1.5), III (2.5), IV (1.8), V (1.8), VI (1) and VII (1.2). Antennomeres II, IV, V, VI and VII with one, three, one, four and one sensillum, respectively. Number of ocelli 3– 4, arranged in 3–4 rows in males; 3–5 in 3–4 rows in female.
COLLUM. Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae Anterior edge semi-circular, posterior margin gently concave.

BODY SEGMENTS ( Figs 161 , 162 ). Lateral keels like poorly developed lateral swellings. Macrochaetae relatively long and trichoid. CIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 1.2; MIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 2.5; PIX (pleurotergite 15) ~ 0.45; MA (pleurotergite 15) ~ 90˚.
TELSON. Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and 3+3 setae (1+1 paramedian, 2+2 marginal). Hypoproct with 1+1 apical setae. Paraprocts with 3+3 marginal setae.
WALKING LEGS . In both sexes, leg-pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs; prefemora with several long and robust setae; femora and postfemora with a group of several long and robust setae.

MALE SEXUAL CHARACTERS ( Fig. 163 ). Leg-pairs 3–7 enlarged. Leg-pairs 3 and 4 each with a basal exterior protrusion on prefemur. Leg-pairs 5 and 6 without peculiarities. Leg-pair 7 with a posterior coxal horn. Leg-pairs 10 and 11 with coxal glands, no other peculiarities.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes. One female representing this genus was collected at Novoprokhladnoye, Adygea, Russia, some 160 airkm from the type locality of
Vegrandosoma tabacarui
gen. et sp. nov. , but in the absence of an adult male, we omit this specimen from treatment [Novoprokhladnoye, Adygea, Russia, 20 May 2004 , K. Voigtländer leg. (SMNG) ( Fig. 170 , white square with a question mark)].
